pkgmetadata.longdescription: Generating Simulated Data Mimicking Response Styles to Survey Questions // Package allows to generate simulated datasets using algorithms that mimic different response styles to survey questions using: 1) IRTree approach (Bockenholt (2012) doi:10.1037/a0028111, (2017) doi:10.1037/met0000106), 2) (G)PCM (and rating scale version of a partial credit model) random- thresholds approach (Falk Cai (2016) doi:10.1037/met0000059; Henninger Meiser (2020a) doi:10.1037/met0000249, (2020b) doi:10.1037/met0000268; Plieninger (2017) doi:10.1177/0013164416636655), 3) user provided function that (with some probability) chooses response using information about previous responses. This allows to cover wide range of potential response styles like: extreme and middle (ERS, MRS), acquiesce (ARS) and also careless/inattentive responding (CR, IR).
